page.title: 08WITHYCOMBE FARM
page.content: MR JOHN CHERRY OWNS WITHYCOMBE FARM NEAR WIGGINGTON HEATH. HE HAS A WIFE & 3 CHILDREN, 1 BOY AND 2 GIRLS. HE OWNS 172 ACRES OF LAND. HE GROWS CORN AND POTATOES,BUT MOST IS GRASSLAND.HE ONLY KEEPS CATTLE IN THE WINTER TO THE VALUE OF Â£500-Â£600. HE HAS A LOT OF MACHINERY SUCH AS 5 TRACTORS,1 COMBINE 1 BAILER AND A POTATO DIGGER. HE HAS 2 CATS, 3 DOGS, 2 BUDGIES, AND SOME RABBITS. HE'S ABOUT 50 YEARS OLD AND HIS SON WANTS TO TAKE OVER THE FARM AFTER MR CHERRY. THE FARM IS MORE SPECIALIZED THAN IT WAS BUT HE STILL ENJOYS TO BE ON THE FARM. HE HAS LIVED HERE FOR 40 YEARS.IF HE WAS NOT A FARMER HE WOULD BE A DESIGNER. ON HIS LAND HE HAS 5 NATURAL SPRINGS NOT MARKED ON THE MAP AND SO HE SAYS HE IS NEVER SHORT OF GOOD CLEAN WATER.
